info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:16AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Steuben, northeastern Noble, De Kalb, Lagrange, southeastern St. Joseph, southern Branch, southwestern Hillsdale and northwestern Williams Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1216 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Bronson to 11 miles southeast of Sturgis to near Lagrange. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Sturgis, Kendallville, Angola, Garrett, Butler, Lagrange, Bronson, Waterloo, Fremont, Hamilton, Rome City, Topeka, Edon, Columbia, Ray, Kinderhook, Fawn River, California and Wolcottville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 328 and 357. Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 116 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
